info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:27AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF HAMILTON, BUTLER AND WESTERN WARREN COUNTIES THROUGH 515 AM EST... At 427 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located near Bright, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Oxford, Lebanon, Forest Park, Springboro, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Trenton, Franklin, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Harrison and North College Hill. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 13 and 31. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 16. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 9 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
